00036 class Config;
00037 extern Config *cfg;
00038 
00039 // -------------------------------------------------
00040 // Representation of file/directory headers on disk
00041 // -------------------------------------------------
00042 //
00043 // 1. First header sector
00044 //
00045 //   .----------------------.
00046 //   |   isDir              | if it is a directory, 1, 0 otherwise
00047 //   |   numBytes           | total size of the data (header excluded)
00048 //   |   numSectors         | total number of sectors
00049 //   |   numHeaderSectors   | number of header sectors
00050 //   .----------------------.
00051 //   |   List of the        | The list of the sector addresses containing data
00052 //   |   Data sectors       | (at most DatasInFirstSector sectors)
00053 //   |                      |
00054 //   . ---------------------.
00055 //   |  Next header sector  | The sector containing the remaining of the
00056 //   |                      | list of data sectors (a "normal" header sector,
00057 //   .----------------------. see below)
00058 //
00059 // 2. The other "normal" header sectors
00060 //
00061 //   .----------------------.
00062 //   |  List of the         | The list of the sector addresses containing data
00063 //   |  Data sectors (ctd.) | (at most DatasInSector sectors)
00064 //   |                      | 
00065 //   .----------------------.
00066 //   |  Next header sector  | The sector containing the remaining of the
00067 //   |                      | list of data sectors (a "normal" header sector,
00068 //   .----------------------. see below)
00069 //
00070 // Be careful when modifying the format of the file header on disk
00071 // Methods FetchFrom and WriteBack assume THIS representation
00072 
00073 // Number of sector numbers that can be stored in the first sector
00074 // representing a file header, which contains a header of 4 ints
00075 // and a trailer of 1 int (5 integers in total)
00076 #define DatasInFirstSector \
00077   ((int)((cfg->SectorSize - 5*sizeof(int)) / sizeof(int)))
00078 
00079 // Number of sector numbers that can be put in a "normal" header sector
00080 #define DatasInSector \
00081   ((int)((cfg->SectorSize - 1*sizeof(int)) / sizeof(int)))
00082 
00083 // Get the value of the next header sector, given the hdrSector array
00084 // of int representing the contents of the current header sector
00085 #define NextHeaderSector(hdrSector) \
00086   (((int*)(hdrSector))[(cfg->SectorSize / sizeof(int)) - 1])
00087 
00089 #define MAX_HEADER_SECTORS 32  
00090 
00092 // (computed according to the disk representation of the file)  
00093 #define MAX_DATA_SECTORS \
00094   ((int)((MAX_HEADER_SECTORS-1)*DatasInSector + DatasInFirstSector))
00095 
00096 #define MAX_FILE_LENGTH \
00097   ((int)((MAX_DATA_SECTORS) * cfg->SectorSize))
00098

00146 };
